In a quaint village, there lived a parrot named Pico who was unlike any other. While his feathered friends chirped phrases and mimicked human voices, Pico remained silent, unable to repeat a single word. The villagers often gathered to laugh at the colorful bird, but Pico didn't mind. He spent his days observing the world around him, soaking in the laughter of children and the whispers of the wind. One day, a storm hit the village, and the villagers panicked. Pico, sensing their fear, squawked a heartfelt melody, calming everyone. They realized that words weren't the only way to communicate; love transcended speech.
